title: Introduction to stringr
text:
The package stringr is useful for playing with strings.



ma_chaine <- "Hello work !"

ma_chaine_trans <- ma_chaine |> stringr::str_to_upper()





ma_chaine <- "Il fait beau et chaud aujourd'hui"

ma_chaine_extrait <- ma_chaine |> stringr::str_extract(pattern = "[a-z]{4} et ")

title: Introduction to stringr
text:
ma_chaine <- "Il fait beau et chaud aujourd'hui"

ma_chaine_extrait <- ma_chaine |> stringr::str_extract(pattern = "[a-z]{4} et ")

How to use it?

title: Introduction to ggplot2
text:
ggplot2 is an amazing package for data visualisation.



Here is a code snippet to produce a beautiful plot done with ggplot2.

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

iris <- iris

ggplot(iris) +
  geom_point(aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Petal.Length, color = Species))

And here is the amazing result.
